meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by inflection or variation in form
meanings.sent1: The flexional endings on the words showed how they changed in form.
meanings.sent2: She studied the flexional patterns in different languages to understand their variations.
meanings.sent3: The flexional dance moves of the robot were quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His mood was as flexional as the changing weather, unpredictable and varied.
meanings.sent5: The flexional nature of the clay allowed the artist to mold it into different shapes easily.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the modification of a word to express different grammatical categories
meanings.sent1: The flexional changes in the nouns indicated their grammatical categories.
meanings.sent2: In Spanish, the flexional endings of verbs change based on the subject.
meanings.sent3: The flexional cat's meows seemed to express different grammatical categories.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were flexional, adapting to express various grammatical categories of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The flexional nature of language allows for precise communication through word modifications.
